org.sandag.popsyn.controls
Class ControlList

java.lang.Object
  org.sandag.popsyn.controls.ControlList

public class ControlList
extends java.lang.Object

For a given control definition and PUMA, this class creates a list of households that belong to the control and PUMA pair. The list takes the form of a Hashmap that contains the mapping between a Household object (key) and its participation factor in the control.

Constructor Detail

ControlList

public ControlList(IControlDefinition<Household> aControlDef,
                   int aPuma,
                   Version aVersion)
Constructs a new ControlList object with the specified control category, PUMA ID, and version object

Parameters:
aControlDef - the control category that the list of balance objects belongs to
aPuma - the PUMA that this ControlList belongs to
aVersion - the version object for this PopSyn run
Method Detail

add

public boolean add(Household t)
Adds Household object (HH or GQ) to the ControlList. Household only gets added if it belongs to the PUMA corresponding to the ControlList. Household only gets added if the relevant control definition is applicable to it. Household only gets added if it is from an appropriate data source and year.

Parameters:
t - the household to be added to the ControlList
Returns:
a boolean where true indicates that the household was added

isHousehold

private boolean isHousehold(Household hh)
Checks if Household object is from an appropriate data source and year.

Parameters:
hh - the Household object to check
Returns:
Returns a boolean where true indicates that the Household object meets the source/year criteria to be added to the ControlList

isRightACSYear

private boolean isRightACSYear(Household hh,
                               int year)
Checks if the Household object has the correct ACS year if not all ACS years can be used. When the acsYear property is set to 0, PUMS households from all ACS years can be used.

Parameters:
hh - the Household object to check
year - the acsYear field of the Version object- a value of zero indicates that PUMS households from all ACS years can be used
Returns:
Returns a boolean where true indicates that the household is from an acceptable year

size

public int size()
Reports the number of objects in the ControlList

Returns:
returns an integer equaling the number of objects in the ControlList

clear

public void clear()
Clears the ControlList of all objects

remove

public void remove(Household t)
Removes a specific Household object from the ControlList

Parameters:
t -

isParticipant

public boolean isParticipant(Household t)
Checks whether a specific balance object participates in the control definition. The object must be a participant and have a participation factor greater than 0.

Parameters:
t - the Household object to check
Returns:
returns a boolean where true indicates the object is a participant

getControlDefinition

public IControlDefinition<Household> getControlDefinition()
Gets the control definition for this ControlList

Returns:
returns the control definition

Retrieves all objects in the ControlList

returns a set of Household objects

public java.lang.Integer getParticipationFactor(Household object)
Looks up the participation factor for an object in the ControlList

Parameters:
object - the object to find the participation factor for
Returns:
returns an integer equaling the participation factor

getControlMap

public java.util.HashMap<Household,java.lang.Integer> getControlMap()
Gets the map between Household objects and their participation factor

Returns:
returns a HashMap object that maps between objects and their participation factor

setControlMap

Sets the map between Household objects and their participation factor

Parameters:
controlMap - the HashMap to use

getPuma

public java.lang.Integer getPuma()
The PUMA that this ControlList pertains to

Returns:

public void setPuma(java.lang.Integer puma)
Sets the PUMA that this ControlList pertains to

Parameters:
puma - the PUMA to associate with the ControlList

print

public void print()
Prints the control definition for this ControlList, prints ID and participation factor of all objects in the ControlList, and prints the total number of objects in the ControlList.

getSortedControlObjects

public java.util.Set<Household> getSortedControlObjects()
Sorts the objects in the ControlMap in ascending order and returns the sorted objects as a Set

Returns:
Returns a Set of sorted Household objects
